cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving west–northwest through the Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest, cross central/western Cuba, then track toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and Florida before curving toward the Southeast U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (likely Big Bend or west-central coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-storm watches/warnings confined to Hispaniola, Jamaica, eastern & central Cuba at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch areas – no watches/warnings north of Cuba/Florida yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles today–Sunday, Cuba Sunday–Monday, Florida Keys/peninsula Monday–Wednesday, then coastal GA–SC–NC late Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Very low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late next work-week; otherwise mainly breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Baltimore given current track guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–2 inches of rain if Elsa’s remnant passes nearby late next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor port schedule disruptions could occur if heavy rain bands cross the Chesapeake Bay area
